records.articleTitle: Testing and Evaluating Driverless Vehicles' Intelligence: The Tsinghua Lion Case Study
records.abstract: It is crucial to test and evaluate the intelligence capacity of driverless vehicles, which impacts the commercialization process of autonomous cars and trucks. This overview aims to summarize the challenging problems in testing and evaluating the intelligence capacity of driverless vehicles. First, the grading of the behavioral intelligence of driverless vehicles is described. Then, to achieve a q...
records.highlightedTitle: Testing and Evaluating Driverless Vehicles' Intelligence: The Tsinghua Lion Case Study

graphicalAbstract.summary: An improved LSTM model is applied to the vehicle behavior recognition problem to identify the left turn, right turn and straight behavior of the vehicle at the intersection.

records.articleTitle: An Improved LSTM Model for Behavior Recognition of Intelligent Vehicles
records.abstract: Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) neural network has been widely used in many applications, but its application in classification of vehicle movement patterns is still limited. In this paper, LSTM is applied to the vehicle behavior recognition problem to identify the left turn, right turn and straight behavior of the vehicle at the intersection. On the basis of the traditional LSTM classification mode...
records.highlightedTitle: An Improved LSTM Model for Behavior Recognition of Intelligent Vehicles

records.articleTitle: Lane Work-Schedule of Toll Station Based on Queuing Theory and PSO-LSTM Model
records.abstract: A reasonable lane work-schedule in each time period can not only guarantee the traffic efficiency of toll stations, but also reduce the operating cost of toll stations. This paper proposes a comprehensive solution for lane work plan. Firstly, the average queue length is selected as a good index for measuring the congestion of toll station. And then, based on the queuing theory, the service level o...
records.highlightedTitle: Lane Work-Schedule of Toll Station Based on Queuing Theory and PSO-LSTM Model

records.articleTitle: A Magnetorheological Fluid-Filled Soft Crawling Robot With Magnetic Actuation
records.abstract: While soft/partially soft-bodied robots have extensive applications, robust actuation system, efficient locomotion gait, and simple manufacture process are the main challenging problems. To address these challenges, this article proposes a novel magnetorheological fluid (MRF)-filled soft crawling robot with magnetic actuation in congested spaces as a transport function. In this new soft robot, MRF...
records.highlightedTitle: A Magnetorheological Fluid-Filled Soft Crawling Robot With Magnetic Actuation

records.abstract: The accuracy of geometric parameters (mainly referred to the incidence angle and measuring distance) in a terrestrial laser scanner (TLS) is not only influenced by the TLS intrinsic systematic instrumental error but also the extrinsic received intensity data. However, the current error compensation methods for geometric parameters mainly focus on the calibration of TLS intrinsic systematic instrum...

records.articleTitle: A Novel Multifeature Based On-Site Calibration Method for LiDAR-IMU System
records.abstract: Calibration is an essential prerequisite for the combined application of light detection and ranging (LiDAR) and inertial measurement unit (IMU). However, current LiDAR-IMU calibration usually relies on particular artificial targets or facilities and the intensive labor greatly limits the calibration flexibility. For these reasons, this article presents a novel multifeature based on-site calibrati...
records.highlightedTitle: A Novel Multifeature Based On-Site Calibration Method for LiDAR-IMU System

records.articleTitle: Using Weighted Total Least Squares and 3-D Conformal Coordinate Transformation to Improve the Accuracy of Mobile Laser Scanning
records.displayPublicationTitle: IEEE Transactions on Geoscience and Remote Sensing
records.abstract: With the aid of global position system (GPS), mobile laser scanning (MLS) is able to provide 3-D geo-referenced point cloud that has centimeter-level accuracy. The MLS accuracy, however, degrades significantly due to the trajectory errors of the laser scanner and the residual systematic errors from the geo-referencing transformation process in the GPS-free environments. To solve this problem, this...
records.highlightedTitle: Using Weighted Total Least Squares and 3-D Conformal Coordinate Transformation to Improve the Accuracy of Mobile Laser Scanning

records.articleTitle: Improving Positioning Accuracy of the Mobile Laser Scanning in GPS-Denied Environments: An Experimental Case Study
records.abstract: The positioning accuracy of the mobile laser scanning (MLS) system can reach the level of centimeter under the conditions where GPS works normally. However, in GPS-denied environments this accuracy can be reduced to the decimeter or even the meter level because the observation mode errors and the boresight alignment errors of MLS cannot be calibrated or corrected by the GPS signal. To bridge this ...
records.highlightedTitle: Improving Positioning Accuracy of the Mobile Laser Scanning in GPS-Denied Environments: An Experimental Case Study

records.articleTitle: A Novel Cooperative Platform Design for Coupled USV–UAV Systems
records.abstract: This paper presents a novel cooperative unmanned surface vehicle-unmanned aerial vehicle (USV-UAV) platform to form a powerful combination, which offers foundations for collaborative task executed by the coupled USV-UAV systems. records.abstract: In this paper, we investigate the trajectory tracking control problem of surface ship subject to the dynamic uncertainties, unknown time-varying disturbances and input saturation. To handle the non-smooth input saturation nonlinearity and compensate the ship dynamic uncertainties, Gaussian error function and adaptive neural network technique are employed. records.articleTitle: Hierarchical Fuzzy Logic-Based Variable Structure Control for Vehicles Platooning
records.displayPublicationTitle: IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems
records.abstract: This paper proposes a variable structure control approach for vehicles platooning based on a hierarchical fuzzy logic. The leader-follower vehicle dynamics with model uncertainties is discussed from the viewpoint of a consensus problem. A practical two-layer fuzzy control for the platooning is designed by employing two common spacing policies to ensure system robustness in different scenarios. The...

records.articleTitle: Multiscale Site Matching for Vision-Only Self-Localization of Intelligent Vehicles
records.abstract: Self-localization is a challenging issue in intelligent vehicle (IV) systems. records.articleTitle: Energy Dissipation Based Longitudinal and Lateral Coupling Control for Intelligent Vehicles
records.abstract: This paper proposes a combined longitudinal and lateral control approach for an intelligent vehicle system based on energy dissipation. The vehicle system dynamics resembles a series of mass/spring/damper systems that are dissipative, i.e., the energy of the system decays to zero eventually. Thus, the nonlinear-optimal longitudinal and lateral coupling control problem of the intelligent vehicle sy...
records.highlightedTitle: Energy Dissipation Based Longitudinal and Lateral Coupling Control for Intelligent Vehicles

records.articleTitle: A New Concentration Detection System for SF6/N2 Mixture Gas in Extra/Ultra High Voltage Power Transmission Systems
records.abstract: This paper develops a new detection system, for the first time, to detect the gas concentrations of the SF6/N2 mixture in extra/ultra-high voltage power transmission systems. The concentrations of SF6 and N2 are calculated from the thermal conductivity function of the mixture gas. The main contribution of this work is that a specially-designed thermostatic chamber with adaptive temperature control...

records.articleTitle: Image Sequence Matching Using Both Holistic and Local Features for Loop Closure Detection
records.abstract: Simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) has a wide range of applications, such as mobile robots, intelligent vehicle localization, and intelligent transportation system. However, loop closure detection is a challenge task for SLAM. This task concerns the difficulty of recognizing already mapped areas. To this end, this paper proposes a novel loop closure detection method called image sequence...

graphicalAbstract.summary: Structural controllability is an important concept for linear systems. It is very difficult to obtain the structural controllability of the system shown in the figure by traditional methods. But the sufficient condition for structural controllability of this system over F(z) can be acquired by a vector matroid method.

records.articleTitle: A Vector Matroid-Theoretic Approach in the Study of Structural Controllability Over F(z)
records.abstract: In this paper, the structural controllability of the systems over F(z) is studied using a new mathematical method-matroids. First, a vector matroid is defined over F(z). Second, the full rank conditions of [sI - A|B](s ∈ p) are derived in terms of the concept related to matroid theory, such as rank, base, and union. Then, the sufficient condition for the linear system and composite system over F(z...
records.highlightedTitle: A Vector Matroid-Theoretic Approach in the Study of Structural Controllability Over F(z)

graphicalAbstract.summary: In this paper, a track geometry surveying model of a scraper conveyor was constructed based on the position of the shearer, which was determined by the dead reckoning method. A surveying instrument was developed that included an IMU and an axial encoder.

records.articleTitle: A Geometry Surveying Model and Instrument of a Scraper Conveyor in Unmanned Longwall Mining Faces
records.abstract: To maintain the straightness of an unmanned longwall mining face, a track geometry surveying model of the scraper conveyor was constructed based on the position of the shearer. A surveying instrument was developed employing an inertial measurement unit and axial encoder. Surveying tests were conducted using a longwall mining face mock-up, and the 3-D accuracy of the surveying instrument based on t...
records.highlightedTitle: A Geometry Surveying Model and Instrument of a Scraper Conveyor in Unmanned Longwall Mining Faces

graphicalAbstract.summary: The cutting efficiency in underground excavations relies on the optimum parameters of the cutting tool and cutting process. This work aims to investigate the tool-rock interaction using a rock cutting mathematical model. The confining pressure was considered in the rock cutting model with conical cutters and discrete element method to calculate dynamics of the rock breakage of this model.

records.articleTitle: Numerical Simulation of Rock Breakage Modes under Confining Pressures in Deep Mining: An Experimental Investigation
records.abstract: The cutting efficiency in underground excavations relies on the optimum parameters of the cutting tool and the cutting process. However, the optimization of the cutting tool design and the cutting process is a challenge and requires knowledge about the tool-rock interaction. This paper aims to investigate the tool-rock interaction using a rock cutting mathematical model. The confining pressure was...
records.highlightedTitle: Numerical Simulation of Rock Breakage Modes under Confining Pressures in Deep Mining: An Experimental Investigation
